Name.label: Rare hemorrhagic disorder due to a constitutional coagulation factors defect

TextSection.Contents: East Texas bleeding disorder is a rare, genetic, coagulation disorder characterized by easy bruising (without hemarthrosis or spontaneous hematomas), epistaxis, menorrhagia, and excessive bleeding after minor trauma and surgical procedures. Patients present a prolonged prothrombin time and/or activated partial thromboplastin time, normal levels of all coagulation factors, and normal protein C activity.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
